result.execSummary:
The defendant James G. Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. James G. Hernandez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • James G. Hernandez was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James G. Hernandez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Regarding DE
$2448.00 due in 30 days or 40 days KCJ or 40 days work crew.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person with Atty Michael Reyes.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.  Victim present; statement made.  Deft fined $1500 plus costs.  Bond to apply.  Balance due in 30 days.  In default, 40 days work crew or 40 days KCJ.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.  Appeal rights.
Sentencing hrg for this afternoon to be rescheduled due to court's unavailability
Sentencing hearing on October 12, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary
Clerk Lehman spoke w/Maryann in Records to cancel material witness warrant for C.H.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Michael Reyes.  State moves for an adjournment; deputies attempted to arrest the complaining witness on the material witness warrant, but she evaded deputies last night.  Defense moves to dismiss; arguments heard.  Defense motion to dismiss is denied.  Court grants the State's motion to adjourn.  JT adj to 10/10/16 @ 9am.  Trial will be PICK & GO on 10/10/16.  Jurors reconvene in courtroom @ 9:48am; released for the day @ 9:50am.  Brief discussion held.  Defense counsel reports the deft wishes to accept an offer made by the defense this morning.  Court takes a short recess to allow the deft to complete the PLQ.  Court reconvenes.  Deft pleads guilty to count 2; found guilty by the Court.  Count 1 is dismissed on State's motion.  Sentencing set over to 9/19/16 @ 1:30pm.  Material witness should be cancelled.  Bond of June 7, 2016, reinstated; parties allowed contact; shall be no violent contact.
Bail/Bond Signed
Process Bureau Control Sheet
Juror Selection & Peremptory Challenges

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Michael Reyes.  State reports difficulty in serving the complaining witness; document provided to the court for review.  State moves to amend the deft's bond to request no contact be re-instated between the deft and the complaining witness.  Brief arguments heard.  Court grants the State's motion.  Deft shall be out of the residence today.  Deft may contact the authorities to set a up a time in which he can go to the residence to remove his belongings - duration of time shall not be longer than 1/2 hour.  State requests a material witness warrant - motion granted.  Defense moves to dismiss w/o prejudice; motion is denied.  Voir dire commences at 11am.  Jury selected @ 12:12pm.  Unselected jurors released for the day @ 12:14pm.  Brief instructions given to the jurors; instructed to return @ 9am on 8/9/16.
Amended Bond signed.

Continued Posted
940.19(1) Battery, DV   /   947.01(1) DC, DV
Voice mail message received from C.H.; wishes to have the deft at home - wants to have contact.  Court agrees to lift the "no contact" order.  File given to Records clerk to prepare an amended bond.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Michael Reyes.  State not ready to proceed; unavailability of witness.  Defense objects to adjournment request; undue hardship between the deft and complaining witness.  Court attempted to reach complaining witness - message left for her to contact the court clerk.  Court will alter the bond to allow contact if the complaining witness still wishes to have contact.  JS adj to 8/8/16 @ 9am.
Email from DE's Attorney

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Michael Reyes.  Due to another case going to trial, JS adj to 6/6/16 @ 9am.  Defense orally moves for bond modification - wishes to have the no contact order removed to allow the deft to go back home.  Brief discussion held.  State objects to any bond modification.  Court will not alter the bond at this time - court would like complaining witness present so she can be questioned by the Court.
Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Reyes (was late).  Due to another case going to trial, this case adjourned to 4/25/16 @ 9am.
of Deft

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Michael Reyes.  Victim rights compliance.  Case is not resolved.  Ludwig hrg held.  Leave on for JS on 2/1/16 @ 9am
Atty Michael Reyes

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Michael Reyes.  Atty Reyes requests a short adjournment; just retained by the deft.  FPT 1/21/16 @ 10am, JS 2/1/16 @ 9am

left for Atty Reyes informing him he will need to contact the DA's office first to see if there is any objection to an adjournment request; otherwise, he can request the adjournment on Monday morning.
Voice mail message received from Atty Michael Reyes @ 4:17pm; states he has been retained by deft.  Needs adjournment of JS date on 11/16/15.

Amended List and   Demand for Discovery
Submitted by ADA James Kraus

Minutes:  NO RECORD TAKEN due to ongoing jury trial.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person pro se.  Deft wishes to represent himself.  Deft will not accept any plea offer.  Leave on for JS for 11/16/15.  Ludwig hrg will need to be conducted prior to commencement of trial
From Courtney H.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
Denied - The Court finds the person is not indigent.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.

143 p.m.    Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State/with Special Prosecutor Daniel Tombasco.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clk  NJurgens.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Deft demands jury trial.  PTC on 9/25/15 @ 140 p.m. & FPT on 10/29/15 @ 9 a.m. & JS on 11/16/15 @ 9 a.m.   $500 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).

Continued Posted
  *No Contact w/ CH (7/2/1985) or her residence.

and witness list filed by the State
